DOC.brief_title: Safety Exercise High-dose Salbutamol Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) Receiving Therapeutic Doses Indacaterol ( QAB 149 ) Salmeterol
DOC.criteria: Patients 40 75 year age diagnose chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) . Female patient must surgically sterilize , postmenopausal use doublebarrier method contraception . Body mass index ( BMI ) must within range 18 32 . Participation clinical investigation experimental drug therapy within four week prior dose longer required local regulation . Donation loss 400 mL blood within two month prior dose . Significant illness ( respiratory ) within two week prior dose . A past medical history , family history ( grandparent , parent sibling ) prolong QTinterval syndrome prolong QTinterval screen . Any clinically significant medical abnormality ( exclude COPD ) limit ability perform standardize exercise protocol cycle ergometer exclude patient . For example , arthritis . History clinically significant drug allergy history atopic allergy ( asthma , urticaria , eczematous dermatitis ) . A known hypersensitivity study drug drug similar study drug . History immunocompromise , include positive HIV , Hepatitis B C test result . History drug alcohol abuse within 12 month prior dose Any condition opinion investigator may compromise patient safety , interfere evaluation , preclude completion trial . Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply
